CTR.Q: What type of chart is this?

VEC.Q: How many labels are in this radar chart?
How many dimensions are in this radar chart?

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the clockwise direction from Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue?
SRP.A: The next dimension clockwise from Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue is Vehicle Utilization Rate

SRP.Q: In the radar chart, what is the next dimension in the counterclockwise direction from Vehicle Utilization Rate?
SRP.A: The next dimension counterclockwise from Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue is Route Optimization Efficiency.

SRP.Q: On the Route Optimization Efficiency, is the point for Phelps, Morris and Villa inside or outside the point for Kim, Mercado and Wallace?
SRP.A: On the Route Optimization Efficiency, the point for Phelps, Morris and Villa is outside the point for Kim, Mercado and Wallace.

VPR.Q: Which label encloses the largest score in the radar chart?
VPR.A: label {Customer Satisfaction } encloses the largest score

VPR.Q: What are the strongest and weakest dimension of Phelps, Morris and Villa?
VPR.A: The strongest aspect is {Customer Satisfaction }, while the weakest aspect is{ Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue}.

VPR.Q: On dimension Service Coverage Rate, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Service Coverage Rate, label {Phelps, Morris and Villa} scores the highest.

VPR.Q: On dimension Route Optimization Efficiency, which label scores the highest?
VPR.A: On Route Optimization Efficiency, label {Kim, Mercado and Wallace} scores the lowest.

VE.Q: What is the value of Phelps, Morris and Villa on the Service Coverage Rate in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Phelps, Morris and Villa on the Safety dimension is {56}.

VE.Q: What is the value of Kim, Mercado and Wallace on the Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue in the radar chart?
VE.A: The value of Kim, Mercado and Wallace on the Safety dimension is {71}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum value of label Phelps, Morris and Villa across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The maximum value of Phelps, Morris and Villa across all dimensions is {39}.

EVJ.Q: What is the minimum value of label Phelps, Morris and Villa across all dimensions in the radar chart?
EVJ.A: The minimum value of Phelps, Morris and Villa across all dimensions is {73}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of Service Coverage Rate
SC.A: The average value of Service Coverage Rate is {60.5}.

SC.Q: What is the average value of Phelps, Morris and Villa
SC.A: The average value of Phelps, Morris and Villa is {55.83}.

NF.Q: Which labels have scores above 37 for the Route Optimization Efficiency dimension? Please list the labels and corresponding scores.
For Phelps, Morris and Villa in the radar chart, which dimensions have scores below 45? Please list the dimensions and corresponding scores.
NF.A: {Route Optimization Efficiency} is {39}, {Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue} is {36}

NF.Q: Which labels have scores below 74 for the Customer Satisfaction  dimension? Please list the labels and corresponding scores.

NC.Q: For Phelps, Morris and Villa, which dimension has a higher score: Service Coverage Rate or Route Optimization Efficiency?
NC.A: {Service Coverage Rate} has a higher score than Route Optimization Efficiency for Phelps, Morris and Villa.

NC.Q: On Vehicle Utilization Rate, which label has a higher score: Phelps, Morris and Villa or the Kim, Mercado and Wallace?
NC.A: {Phelps, Morris and Villa} has a higher score on Vehicle Utilization Rate compared to Kim, Mercado and Wallace.

NC.Q: For Kim, Mercado and Wallace, which dimension has a higher score: Vehicle Utilization Rate or Customer Satisfaction  or Fuel Cost as Rate of Revenue?
NC.A: {Customer Satisfaction } has a higher score for Kim, Mercado and Wallace.

NC.Q: For Phelps, Morris and Villa, which dimension has a higher score: Customer Satisfaction  or Service Coverage Rate or Damage/Loss Rate ?
NC.A: {Customer Satisfaction } has a higher score for Phelps, Morris and Villa.

MSR.Q: For Kim, Mercado and Wallace, based on the data shown in the radar chart, which dimension does it most need to improve?
MSR.A: Kim, Mercado and Wallace most needs to improve its {Vehicle Utilization Rate}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the strongest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the strongest overall capability is {Phelps, Morris and Villa}.

MSR.Q: In the radar chart, which label has the weaknest overall capability across all labels?
MSR.A: The label with the weaknest overall capability is {Kim, Mercado and Wallace}.
